programme.title: Reef Wrecks
programme.desc: The Bahamas is known as the "underwater movie capital of the world". Hollywood has been coming here for decades, making epic movies and TV shows in its crystal clear waters, leaving behind a host of cinematic shipwrecks.

programme.title: Wild Pacific Rescue
programme.desc: Join the vet and his team in saving a massive sea lion caught in a plastic noose, and then visit the Rescue Centre, where a harbour seal pup may lose its eyesight and a baby sea otter needs a risky but life-saving surgery.

programme.title: Wild Pacific Rescue
programme.desc: Battle wind and waves to find a sea lion trapped in a plastic ring. Then visit the rescue centre, where over 80 orphan seals must be fed several times a day to prepare for release into the wild, and see an Amazonian duck get a miraculous operation.

programme.title: Wild Pacific Rescue
programme.desc: Follow the team in healing and releasing a grumpy sea turtle, and then meet a sea lion with an unusual injury that must be taken by crane to the rescue centre. Find out how the vet aids an aging fruit bat and a community rescues a one-eyed seal pup.

programme.title: Shadowlands
programme.desc: The southwest corner of New Zealand's South Island is hemmed in by giant mountains and the rough Pacific Ocean. Rare penguins are locked in a daily game of cat and mouse with giant New Zealand sea lions. The sea lions also live in a tumultuous world, where pups must battle the elements to survive.

programme.title: Shadowlands
programme.desc: In southwestern New Zealand, deep fiords and tidal lagoons are wrapped in green rainforest. The dark fjords harbour creatures normally found in the deep. As winter approaches, bottlenose dolphins must escape their freezing fjord, while in a mountain river, a longfin eel heeds the call of the sea.

programme.title: Shadowlands
programme.desc: The south-eastern coast of New Zealand are some of the richest fishing grounds in the world - the place for young marine animals to transition from novices to independent adults. Young whales, dolphins and seals learn to hunt, learn the rules of society, or strike out on their own adventures.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild Australia
programme.desc: Australia is home to one of the most successful mammals on the planet: the bat. And one of the most gregarious of its kind is the flying fox. With its metre-long wingspan, the grey-headed flying fox is the largest fruit-eating bat in the country.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild Australia
programme.desc: Marsupials have evolved in isolation to become some of the most extraordinary creatures on the planet. While they all share similarities, some of the rare smaller species like quokkas and quolls highlight their fascinating differences.

programme.title: Wild Pacific Rescue

programme.desc: Australia is home to one of the most successful mammals on the planet: the bat. And one of the most gregarious of its kind is the flying fox. With its metre-long wingspan, the grey-headed flying fox is the largest fruit-eating bat in the country.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild Australia
programme.desc: Marsupials have evolved in isolation to become some of the most extraordinary creatures on the planet. While they all share similarities, some of the rare smaller species like quokkas and quolls highlight their fascinating differences.

programme.title: Nature Scenes
programme.desc: One half hour of uninterrupted bull sharks deep in Cozumel's underwater reefs. Watch as these huge sharks swim and interact with the other inhabitants of these coral reefs.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: A Hawaiian volcano called Kilauea is one of the most active in the world. After years of constant lava activity, see how a sudden collapse of the crater floor and a massive eruption drains it of lava, making the volcano possible to explore.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: Visit Anak Krakatoa as it enters a violent phase. Known as "The Child of Fire," this volcano is an ancestor of Krakatoa, a volcano known for the largest eruption in modern history. Will its descendant repeat the pattern?

programme.title: Africa's Wild Horizons
programme.desc: Nestled on Africa's southwestern tip lies a spectacular mountain range, home to an incredible diversity of life, including the elusive Cape mountain leopard. Follow a team using every trick in the book to catch a glimpse of this mysterious creature.

programme.title: Arabian Inferno
programme.desc: Discover a land where reptiles rule. More than 170 species of reptiles live in Arabia, including the two-foot vegetarian dhub, the bad-tempered monitor lizard, geckos with night vision, and massive sea turtles that come ashore only to lay their eggs.

programme.title: Tales From Zambia
programme.desc: Visit animals in three extraordinary habitats: a baby giraffe takes its first steps in the sweltering Luangwa Valley, two thousand baboons have found a paradise in a Kasanka forest, and a cheetah family prowls for meat on the desolate Liuwa Plain.

programme.title: Shadowlands
programme.desc: The southwest corner of New Zealand's South Island is hemmed in by giant mountains and the rough Pacific Ocean. Rare penguins are locked in a daily game of cat and mouse with giant New Zealand sea lions. The sea lions also live in a tumultuous world, where pups must battle the elements to survive.

programme.title: Into The Wild Colombia
programme.desc: Follow brave Mona, a cotton top tamarin, who's left her birth family to find a new home and a mate. Navigating torrential downpours and deadly predators, Mona must be shrewd, savvy and secretive. Even if she finds a new family, will they accept her?

programme.title: Into The Wild Colombia
programme.desc: Julieta is a golden dart frog, one of earth's most poisonous creatures. This tiny, 2 inch mom is close to laying her eggs and needs them fertilized. From deep within the dangerous rainforest her Romeo calls. Join her on an epic mission to find him.

programme.title: Colombia's Wild Coast
programme.desc: Gorgona was once home to Colombia's Alcatraz. Modelled on Nazi concentration camps, prisoners dreamt of escape. See the island's stunning wildlife through the eyes of a convict on the run, the monkeys, snakes and sloths who've now reclaimed the land.

programme.title: Colombia's Wild Coast
programme.desc: On the island of Providencia, a black crab begins the mission of her life, escorting 80,000 eggs from her home, on a 3 km hike to the coast. Join her, and millions of her clan, on a journey fraught with danger, where chances of survival are slim.

programme.title: Wildest New Zealand
programme.desc: Two wild fortresses defend New Zealand's vulnerable native animals: one a remote island protected by a moat of saltwater, the other a hilltop citadel surrounded by a predator-proof barrier.

programme.title: Wildest New Zealand
programme.desc: Spring on the east coast is a time of promise for two iconic island species: the New Zealand fur seal and the northern royal albatross. Both have returned to the land of their birth to breed.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Horizons
programme.desc: Nestled on Africa's southwestern tip lies a spectacular mountain range, home to an incredible diversity of life, including the elusive Cape mountain leopard. Follow a team using every trick in the book to catch a glimpse of this mysterious creature.

programme.title: Arabian Inferno

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Follow penguins, iguanas, tortoises, frogs, and tamarins from Mexico to Peru and as far west as the Galapagos Islands as they live out their daily dramas, affected by the sun's heat, looming predators, and hazardous weather conditions.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: See how creatures from the Tibetan plateau, to the lush rainforests of Thailand, to Vietnam's twisted mangroves, survive four extra hours of daylight once a year, searching for food, fighting for dominance, and raising their families.

programme.title: Tales From Zambia
programme.desc: Visit animals in three extraordinary habitats: a baby giraffe takes its first steps in the sweltering Luangwa Valley, two thousand baboons have found a paradise in a Kasanka forest, and a cheetah family prowls for meat on the desolate Liuwa Plain.

programme.title: Untamed Valley
programme.desc: Dive into Kasikizi Lagoon, where hippos go to escape the hustle and bustle of the river bends. Meet other residents of this wild sanctuary, from water scorpions to fish eagles to marabou storks hoping to steal a quick meal before the oasis dries up.

programme.title: Untamed Valley
programme.desc: Battle the beachmaster, a giant hippo who rules a two-mile-long section of the river's biggest bend. Watch his fellow creatures evade the Nsefu pride of lions, who are looking for an easy meal, unless a Nile crocodile decides to steal their dinner.

programme.title: Nature Scenes
programme.desc: One half hour of uninterrupted marine wildlife in Cozumel. Dive underwater to discover the huge diversity within these coral reefs. Get up close with sea turtles, colourful fish, eel and more.

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Enjoy the spring baby boom at the centre as the staff go gaga over an adorable bundle of baby possums. Then see the rescue team hit a rooftop patio for a little R and R: retrieving and rescuing a mama and her ducklings perched high above the city.

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: See staff care for baby bunnies injured in a dog attack and then join the centre's release team as they introduce an abandoned cygnet to an adoptive mother swan, and find that things don't go exactly as planned.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Horizons
programme.desc: Journey to the Namib Desert, where baking sand meets icy ocean. Inhospitable dunes house a surprising host of creatures, from the sidewinding adder to the fog-collecting beetle. Discover the survival tricks needed to thrive in this biological marvel.

programme.title: Arabian Inferno
programme.desc: The Arabian Desert is one of the most challenging places on earth, so its inhabitants must be resilient and specialized. Explore the unique adaptations of the unicorn-inspiring Arabian oryx, Ruppell's fox, and the elusive sand cat.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: Researcher Andrea Marshall believes Mozambique-based manta rays may be attending the sardine run on South Africa's Wild Coast. The question is: why? Follow researchers as they track the creatures to understand their unusual migrating patterns.

programme.title: Shadowlands
programme.desc: In southwestern New Zealand, deep fiords and tidal lagoons are wrapped in green rainforest. The dark fjords harbour creatures normally found in the deep. As winter approaches, bottlenose dolphins must escape their freezing fjord, while in a mountain river, a longfin eel heeds the call of the sea.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild Australia
programme.desc: Crocodiles are formidable predators, superbly adapted with skull-crushing jaws and lightning speed. They were on Earth long before the dinosaurs, and have outlived them by millions of years. Now protected in Australia, their numbers have surged.

programme.title: Big Cat Country
programme.desc: Meet the MK pride, led by two mighty males called the Punks, who are growing old. See younger members test their mettle as they face off with the all-male Nomad pride and the all-female Hollywood pride to defend the territory they've held for years.

programme.title: Deadly Australians
programme.desc: A motley crew of killers, con artists, and gang members fight for supremacy amidst the dry and desolate Australian desert. Here, heat and dehydration kill indiscriminately and competition for resources is brutal. Only the toughest survive.

programme.title: Deadly Australians
programme.desc: The Australian coastline is a magnet for marine assassins of all shapes and sizes. Though they vary in appearance and tactics, these vicious predators share one common trait: they are all exceptional killers.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: The food chain of Africa's savannah is a complex web of wildlife that entangles landscape-altering elephants, vast herds of antelope, apex predators, and a range of other species that have evolved to survive in this diverse and brutal landscape.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Follow a day in the life of a gregarious meerkat family in the mighty Kalahari Desert of South Africa. Led by a dominant female, the family must find food, tutor pups, and avoid predators in a scorched land where only the toughest survive.

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue

programme.title: Africa's Wild Horizons
programme.desc: In one of the most hostile habitats on earth, the world's largest mammal has made a home. Meet the last desert elephants and see how they traverse formidable sand and stone wastelands, surviving on a mix of stamina, smarts and ancient knowledge.
